page.title: 11MULLION HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: At Mullion Health Centre there are 3 full-time doctors and one trainee doctor who is on a one-year practice. The area Health Authority supplies a midwife,a health visitor and a bath nurse for the elderly. A chiropodist makes a visit every fortnight.Mullion doctors encourage women to have their babies at home, a practice which is discouraged in most areas, where expectant mothers go into hospital. The doctors are willing to extend this service to Helston and St.Keverne. The practice has surgeries each day except Sunday, and there is usually a doctor present should emergency treatment be required.Also there are antenatal and postnatal classes, relaxation classes,parent- craft classes,a baby clinic and a family planning clinic. From April 1984 to April 1985, 24 girls and 33 boys were born.
